channel.title: [PI] Quest log update
channel.description: How do i update the quest log for pi so i dont haave to log iout and back in to see the quest interface ad the quests change colors after i start and finish the quest my other interfaces seem to update automaticly but the quest interface is doing absolouly no updates while anyone is in game

item.title: [PI] Quest log update
item.dc:creator: @emtrescue emtrescue
item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

changing it in playerass as a void and have the void loading in processes and it doesnt change

for exzample

public void quests(){
if (c.quest1 = step 0){
sM("@red@ RFD", 182);}
else if(c.quest1 >= step 1);{
sM("@yel@ RFD", 182);}
}

sidebar interface didnt work

ooh ill call the quest tabs
what is the interface id? :s i dont have this one in my collection yet

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Quest log update
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

ravens:

you can put it under process(){ in client.java and it will automatically update, however it is probably best not to add too much things there because it has a high chance that it could decrease performance

Indeed , lol

@OP

  1. make the int representing the quest status change according to the quest status.
  2. right after changing the int , call the method to write the quest tabs. ( as if it were refreshing )
  3. in the method where you changed the quets tab text , make sure you editted the different types ( quest status 0 -> red , quest status 2 -> yellow , quest status 3 -> green)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Quest log update
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

I think it only gets loaded 1 time , upon logging in.
Make it update when youâ€™ve applied changes to it ( like when you want it to change to green or yellow )

This also depends in what method and in what class you are writing the quest update.

you can change it in the client.java class and the playerassistant.java , where are you changing it from?
